thread.title: Tottenham give teenage Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink trial with other Premier League clubs interest
thread.title_full: Tottenham give teenage Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink trial with other Premier League clubs interest

author: leeastley
title: Tottenham give teenage Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink trial with other Premier League clubs interest

organizations.name: europa league walk-ing on water barcelona

text:
Here Wee go Tottenham give teenage Dutch goalkeeper Nick Weegink trial with other Premier League clubs interest 
The 15-year-old will spend a week training at White Hart Lane as he looks to impress the Premier League club By LEE ASTLEY Comments TOTTENHAM have handed 15-year-old Dutch Keeper Nick Weegink a trial with other Premier League clubs interested. 
Weegink trains at the Keepers School Regio Twente under former Twente player Michel Vuerink and will spend a week trying to impress coaches at White Hart Lane. Instagram @nickweegink 2 Dutch youngster Nick Weegink, 15, has been given a weeks trial by Tottenham 
Former West Bromwich Albion and Ipswich Town midfielder Romeo Zondervan sent videos of the youngster to Premier League clubs which drew interest from a number of clubs. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And Spurs acted quickly to give Weegink a chance to earn himself a deal with the clubs youth team. 
Weegink currently represents Dutch fourth-tier side ATC’65’s youth team after spending a year-and-a-half with Twente’s academy. A post shared by Nick weegink (@nickweegink) on Jan 8, 2017 at 1:53am PST 
Spurs take on Gent in the second leg of their Europa League and will look to overturn a 1-0 deficit. 
Boss Mauricio Pochettino said the game is “another Wembley final” for his team. 
Poch said: “We need to use all our energy to find a way to the next round.
